text:
Some things can be taken on face value. Your friend who's restaurant recommendations are faultless. Break this beer down and there is not a single part that I would change.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 Clear orange brown with generous, thick nitrous head. Looks fantastic. Caramel and piney hop aroma. Smooth hop flavour as well, fruity but also pretty grassy. The mouthfeel, wow! So smooth!! Like a milkshake, only hoppy. My first IPA on nitro and I will be looking out for more. Very dangerous this one, goes down a little too easy...

Lovely red amber colour, with a nice head. Lots of hops - kiwi fruit, melon, pineapple on the nose, with a nice fresh lemon and honey flavour. Love the malts! Sweet but not cloying, with a brisk bitter finish. High alcohol but who would know?! Yum!
Overrated, slight vegetable flavour. Gone down hill since the early days. Bring back DJ

500ml can from Beer Cartel, Sydney. Amber-brown colour with a reddish tinge, big tan head leaving lacing and aroma of mango, passionfruit, hoppy. Taste is sweetish, malt, caramel, orangey, floral hoppy with earthy bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry mellow finish. Nicely drinkable.

Can at a tasting. High bitterness, but overall impression is balanced, with medium-high malty influence, caramelly, red fruits, burnt sugar. Hoppiness is citrusy, zesty, fruity. Very tasty, very good.
Can from MartinB, many thanks. Red Amber color with thick off-white head. Aroma of caramel, distinct citrus hops. Taste, caramel malt, followed by citrus hops with zest, pines. Good.

Sensational hazy ruby red deep amber shade with perfect dirty off white creamy head. Nose of mango, passionfruit and pineapple with hint of toffee malt. Delicious creamy texture, tropical fruit, citris, pine hops and light toasted malt up front. Syrupy and slightly nutty. Mild bitterness in the backend. Very well balanced between hops, malt. Super smooth and bitter all at the same time. Very enjoyable and easy drinking.

Aroma of caramel, pears, dates, figs and a really really really faint hint of smoke. Flavour of burnt toffee and blood orange. Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark with a nice red tinge. Big Tropical fruit and citrus nose. A nice piney/resin up front with a big toasty caramel malt backing it up.

A perfect Aussie pale ale. A huge cross section of hops from buttering, flavour and aroma but balanced by a lovely malty Amber backbone. Unusually well balanced. Depending upon the temperature, the hop profile goes from spicy/peppery to citrus and slightly floral. Awesome.

500ml can pours deep reddish brown with an off-white head of very fine bubbles. Strong hoppy aromas of grapefruit and passionfruit. Any sweetness from the caramel malt is nicely offset with pink grapefruit sourness and herbal spice. Mild carbonation keeps it refreshing and hides the 7.8% alcohol nicely. Long bitter grapefruit rind finish.

Can at home. Lovely Amber colour and cream head. Huge fresh hop aromas. Farmy, citrus, spruce and resin. Medium bitter and mild sweet following. Faint mango as described but not much passionfruit. Side note: Dad was certain that this was less bitter than a Coopers Vintage Ale. Just checked, its not.
Growler fill. Top notch tropical IPA. Has a bit of class to it with the oomph of a pick up. Very dry finish.

500 ml can from Hawthorne Cellars. Pours ruby red with medium tan head. Sweet aroma of tropical fruit. Flavour is definitely hop forward, but nicely balanced with malt and fruit. Very enjoyable and I will buy again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep ruby with a large head.
Nose shows heavy malt with caramel notes alongside piny and resinous hops by the truckload.
Flavours include more heavy malt and syrupy notes, resinous hops, caramel, soft booze and fruit confectionery.

A lingering bitter red IPA. Heavy pepper and herbal spice flavour after a initial burst of citrus. Made with Galaxy and Mosiac hops this red IPA is a staple of the Modus range.
This big beer should be consumed ideally from the Modus Canimal can. A massive 1L can. Drinking one of those bad boys is way to easy, but when the missus says "you should really cut back to one beer a night", then this is the beer you should have. And technically, its still one beer.right!

Light red - amber with a medium cream coloured head. Looks clear and well carbonated. Wonderful fresh tropical amd floral hop aromas, with some lovely sweet dark fruit - berries, raisins (from malt) aromas that balance well. Incredible rich and complex flavors. Toasty caramel with dark fruit malt flavors with a medium tropical hop bitterness with a slight grassiness that balances it all so well. Medium body with a smooth as silk texture and slight but gorgeous alcohol warming. Holy shit this beer is good.

On tap at Modus Operandi, pours a hazy dark amber orange with a small beige head. Aroma brings out rich resinous hops and caramel malt in good balance. Flavour is rich, with pungent resinous hops upfront and a pretty sweet caramel malt backbone. Malty and chewy, but not too sweet. Very good.
Great fruity nose full of Australian hops, the malt character is present but doesnt over ride the great hop notes. Superbly balanced and delicious.
Solid red ale - chewy malt well balanced by plenty of hops - a sipper - not my preferred style but enjoyed - one was enough.

Deep brick red pour with a decent tan head.Huge citrus, stonefruit, passionfruit, caramel aromas. Taste is initially, sweetish, fruity, malty, then big peach, passionfruit, resiny, nice bitterness comes through but not overwhelming, just beautifully balanced beer.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 Tasted multiple times at New Brighton Hotel, Royal Albert and this time at the brewery. Much as I love a Hahn Superdry, this could be my fave Australia beer. Attractive ruby colour and off-white head. Big big tropical nose and sweetness nicely balanced by hops. There is definitely something in the water at Mona Vale!

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 On tap at Bosc, West End. Ruby red is an accurate description of this brew in the glass. The fruity hop nose has a hint of grapefruit in it and this carries through to the palate. Rich malt backbone hides the ethanol content making the finish a bit sweet. A very nice red.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Squealer from the brewery. Quite clear, red tinge, minimal white head. Massive stone fruit, passionfruit and earth aromas. Peach, apricots and earth with a solid malt backing. The bitterness is in the front and mid palate without the cloying finish that I tire of in most ipa’s. Rich mouth feel, minimal carbonation. Obvious American influences with the massive passionfruit elements but there is also a big earthy English influence which I like. Love this beer.

On tap at the brewery. A slightly hazy ruby-Amber with a fine, somewhat lasting off-White head. Striking and assertive aromas of pine and resin combined with tropical fruits and citrus. Medium to full in body, medium carbonation and a long, full finish of bittersweet hop x malt.

My favourite Australian beer. Pours a ruby red colour. Didnt have too much head. Incredible aroma! Citrusy grapefruit taste dominates for me. Quite a bitter finish and seemed to get further bitterness as it warmed. Love this beer.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Draught middy size at The Royal Albert Hotel, Sydney, on October 11, 2015.Hazy dark brown color, tan lasting dense head. Roasted, bitter, herbal, hoppy taste. Citrus, bitter aftertaste. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Roasted, citrus hoppy scent.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Alluring tropical fruit aroma in an amber-ruby pour. Flavour is hop forward and well balanced with a restrained clean finish.
GABS Melb 2015: I think these guys are pretty good. Modern IPA with plenty of friendly fruit, toffee and super classy hops to tie it all together. Well balanced and surprisingly powerful.
Hop herbal spice malt flavour. Clear deep Amber colour great head and lacing. Malt spicer herbal hop flavour. Smooth lingering palate.
Gertrude Hotel ontap(4-Jul-2015)Dark red,white head&sheet lace.Sweet herbal berry biscuit malt flavour.Bitter herbal spirit berry&spirit malt herbal aftertaste.

Can 946ml - pours Amber red with an off white head. Biggest aroma Ive come across in a while, nettles, mango, mandarins, caramel, resin and rhubarb and custard Lolly; Huge mix of aromas! Taste is creamy a and well balanced some immediate sweetness temperd by the hops which never over do it. The finish is slightly citrus and just goes and goes. Palate is creamy and full. Best beer Ive had in a while.
On tap at Henson Park Hotel. Deep red brown, small foamy head. Pine bread aromas, nice medium bitter finish. Went down well with a "knuckle sandwich".

I had to rate this because its that good. Simple. On tap at the Royal Albert Hotel in Sydney and at GABS Festival. A beautiful rich red appearance with a full creamy head, the aroma is of tropical fruits. A wonderful full mouthfeel, beautifully balanced and tastes of pine, mango and just enough sweetness from a predominant caramel maltness. Throw in that great lasting bitterness on the palate and you have pretty much as good a RIPA as you?ll find. Modus have nailed it with this one, a comment even echoed by Moa founder Josh Scott. So good I had to take 3 x 960ml cans of it back home on the plane with me!
On tap at Foresters Hall. Lovely caramel aroma. Full bodied, biscuity red ale. Toasty, sugared flavours built around a complex, well-rounded malt profile. Fantastic effort.

946ml can from Oak Barrel, Sydney (date filled 18/3/15, ABV 7.8%). Dark red-orange with a medium-sized stable off-white head. Aroma offers plenty of hoppy notes with oranges, pineapple, passionfruit and pine resin above a toasty biscuity crystal malt bill. Palate provides heaps of citrusy and resinous hop bitterness against the toasty malts with a medium-fullish body and a slick spritely mouthfeel. Hop bitterness is strong and lingering. A lovely hoppy red IPA.

Huge 946ml can. Ruby red with large frothy beige head. Big citrus, flowery and tropical fruit aromas rising above a malty base. The taste is quite the reverse, with the sweet maltiness forward and the hops in the background. Medium bodied and not too sticky for its big 7.6% ABV. Really good brew.

Incredibly good. Attractive deep ruby with a pack of fruity hops. Complex malts with a full mouthfeel. Not such a bitter base which shows off the caramel malts and lets you enjoy the finishing hops. That good.
Pretty complex malt profile going on. Hops are there of course and the bitterness is well rounded without being astringent. A great RIPA.
red IPA, West coast amber ale, whatever you call it this is a fantastic offering. Big hoppy nose, appropriate bitterness and a hint of crystal sweetness. on tap at the durham. Very nice indeed.

On tap (hand pull) at Harts pub. Beautiful citric hop nose. Amber red with small head. Surprisingly thin body with grapefruit bitterness at the end. This is 7.1%?, hides it well. Clean slight hop finish, a little alcohol burn late on. Amazingly light for its ABV.

On tap at bobs bar. Pours deep Amber with a very thin cream head.Pine and tropical on the nose. First taste is of strong toffee malts carrying into a sweet pine and resin bitter finish. Great balance between malt and hops.

Pours an amber/red colour with a minimal head. There is a pleasant aroma of citrus and resin. This beer sits well on the palate with a nicely bitter aftertaste, indicative of a good combination of hops and malt. A really good beer.

On tap at the Keg & Brew, Surry Hills. Pours a dark cloudy red with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, very fruity, pine, plenty of hops with hints of spices. Taste is high sweet leading to a big fruity and hoppy finish. Excellent!

Draught @the Grain store
Clear copper in colour, holds a tight white head.
Good intensity aroma; toffeed malt, toasted nuts with plenty of resiny, spicy woody, cooked citrus hop.
Slick sticky resiny texture, full body, soft carbonation.
Packs plenty of flavour in; woody spice, grapefruit rind, toasted malts, amber toffee, leafy herbs. Plenty of bitterness, but very smooth and balanced finish.
Very well made, rather tasty!

On tap at Archive Beer Boutique 211114. Certainly is red in colour but does not have much of a head. Caramel and toffee aromas. This is a very malt heavy beer that carries the alcohol well. Full in the mouth and has a long finish.
UPDATED: OCT 22, 2015 On tap. Great hop aroma. Red and tasty. not sessionable and bitterness is a little out of balance
Deep Red pour. Aroma is spicy earthy aromatic hops. Flavours are the same with a nice bitterness beautiful balance. Good bite on the finish and nice spicyness. Great red IPA.
On tap at The Archive. Pours ruby red with a thin head, big grapefruit aroma and flavours, very smooth and dangerously drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Tap. Clear reddish amber with off white head. Big noseful of grapefruit toffee spices passionfruit, hash. Sweet sticky breadcrust, lots of resinous dank, lesser tropical notes, mild spices.Bitterness is not huge but shines through really well as the sweetness disappears like a trap shutting. Less my sort of thing than the Zoo Feeder, but damned fine. [3.8]Growler. Really like the way the citrus bounds through again at the end to relieve the palate after the fat maltiness. Dangerously drinkable.

Crowler thanks to the main man Owen! Pours hazy amber with a sticky beige head. Nose is hugely focused on pineapple and pine needles - absolutely punchy as all hell with a nice dose of lychee in there. The taste is brutally bitter sweet with loads of tropical fruits - pineapple, blood orange and a huge amount of juicy lychee. Usually lychee turns me off due to the sweetness but the malt bill in this holds it up incredibly well. Perfect carbonation, no hint of the ABV, astringent bitterness and perfect drinkability. World class stuff

On tap at the brewery

Dark ruby red color. Persistent light tan head. 2 finger head that falls to a thick collar. Spotty lacing. Great looking beer.
Nose is pine and grapefruit. Massive nose. Lots of citrus and hops in this. Just notes of caramel backbone. Very US style. 
Full of resin and oil. Highly bitter but backed well by the body. Pine, grapefruit, and orange peel in the taste. Hides the 7.8% well. 
Exceptional IPA for Australia top stuff

The best smelling beer ever. A different aroma with every mouthful. A massive blend of floppies and hops. This beer drinks like a 5% not 7.8% which makes it slightly dangerous for those who love it's flavour!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
